content:
TITLE: Creating Particle System using Module Imports
DESCRIPTION: Example showing how to create a particle system using module imports, including emitter configuration with various initializers and behaviors.
SOURCE: https://github.com/creativelifeform/three-nebula/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-20_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
import System, {
  Emitter,
  Rate,
  Span,
  Position,
  Mass,
  Radius,
  Life,
  Velocity,
  PointZone,
  Vector3D,
  Alpha,
  Scale,
  Color,
} from 'three-nebula';
import * as THREE from 'three';

const system = new System();
const emitter = new Emitter();
const renderer = new SpriteRenderer(threeScene, THREE);

// Set emitter rate (particles per second) as well as the particle initializers and behaviours
emitter
  .setRate(new Rate(new Span(4, 16), new Span(0.01)))
  .setInitializers([
    new Position(new PointZone(0, 0)),
    new Mass(1),
    new Radius(6, 12),
    new Life(3),
    new RadialVelocity(45, new Vector3D(0, 1, 0), 180),
  ])
  .setBehaviours([
    new Alpha(1, 0),
    new Scale(0.1, 1.3),
    new Color(new THREE.Color(), new THREE.Color()),
  ]);

// add the emitter and a renderer to your particle system
system
  .addEmitter(emitter)
  .addRenderer(renderer)
  .emit({ onStart, onUpdate, onEnd });
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Creating Particle System from JSON Configuration
DESCRIPTION: Example demonstrating how to instantiate a particle system from a JSON configuration object with multiple emitters and behaviors.
SOURCE: https://github.com/creativelifeform/three-nebula/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-20_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
import System from 'three-nebula';

const json = {
  preParticles: 500,
  integrationType: 'euler',
  emitters: [
    {
      rate: {
        particlesMin: 5,
        particlesMax: 7,
        perSecondMin: 0.01,
        perSecondMax: 0.02,
      },
      position: {
        x: 70,
        y: 0,
      },
      initializers: [
        {
          type: 'Mass',
          properties: {
            min: 1,
            max: 1,
          },
        },
        {
          type: 'Life',
          properties: {
            min: 2,
            max: 2,
          },
        },
        {
          type: 'BodySprite',
          properties: {
            texture: './img/dot.png',
          },
        },
        {
          type: 'Radius',
          properties: {
            width: 80,
            height: 80,
          },
        },
      ],
      behaviours: [
        {
          type: 'Alpha',
          properties: {
            alphaA: 1,
            alphaB: 0,
          },
        },
        {
          type: 'Color',
          properties: {
            colorA: '#4F1500',
            colorB: '#0029FF',
          },
        },
        {
          type: 'Scale',
          properties: {
            scaleA: 1,
            scaleB: 0.5,
          },
        },
        {
          type: 'Force',
          properties: {
            fx: 0,
            fy: 0,
            fz: -20,
          },
        },
      ],
    },
    {
      rate: {
        particlesMin: 5,
        particlesMax: 7,
        perSecondMin: 0.01,
        perSecondMax: 0.02,
      },
      position: {
        x: -70,
        y: 0,
      },
      initializers: [
        {
          type: 'Mass',
          properties: {
            min: 1,
            max: 1,
          },
        },
        {
          type: 'Life',
          properties: {
            min: 2,
            max: 2,
          },
        },
        {
          type: 'BodySprite',
          properties: {
            texture: './img/dot.png',
          },
        },
        {
          type: 'Radius',
          properties: {
            width: 80,
            height: 80,
          },
        },
      ],
      behaviours: [
        {
          type: 'Alpha',
          properties: {
            alphaA: 1,
            alphaB: 0,
          },
        },
        {
          type: 'Color',
          properties: {
            colorA: '#004CFE',
            colorB: '#6600FF',
          },
        },
        {
          type: 'Scale',
          properties: {
            scaleA: 1,
            scaleB: 0.5,
          },
        },
        {
          type: 'Force',
          properties: {
            fx: 0,
            fy: 0,
            fz: -20,
          },
        },
      ],
    },
  ],
};

new System.fromJSONAsync(json, THREE).then(system => {
  console.log(system);
});
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Three Nebula via npm
DESCRIPTION: Command to install the Three Nebula package using npm package manager.
SOURCE: https://github.com/creativelifeform/three-nebula/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-20_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm i --save three-nebula
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Including Three Nebula via Script Tag
DESCRIPTION: HTML script tag to include Three Nebula directly in the webpage.
SOURCE: https://github.com/creativelifeform/three-nebula/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-20_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: html
CODE:
```
<script type='text/javascript' src='node_modules/three-nebula/build/three-nebula.js'></script>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Accessing Three Nebula via Window Object
DESCRIPTION: Example showing how to access Three Nebula classes when included via script tag using the window object.
SOURCE: https://github.com/creativelifeform/three-nebula/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-20_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
const { System, Emitter, Rate, Span } = window.Nebula;
const system = new System();
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Three Nebula Source Code in Development Mode
DESCRIPTION: Commands to navigate to the Three Nebula directory and start the development server for the source code.
SOURCE: https://github.com/creativelifeform/three-nebula/blob/master/website/README.md#2025-04-20_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
cd /path/to/three-nebula
npm run dev
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Linking Three Nebula Source to Website and Running Development Server
DESCRIPTION: Commands to navigate to the Three Nebula website directory, link the source code, and start the development server for the website.
SOURCE: https://github.com/creativelifeform/three-nebula/blob/master/website/README.md#2025-04-20_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
cd /path/to/three-nebula/website
npm run link-src && npm run dev
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Markdown Changelog Entry v1.2.0
DESCRIPTION: Documents addition of GDPR features and analytics architecture in version 1.2.0
SOURCE: https://github.com/creativelifeform/three-nebula/blob/master/website/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-20_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
## `v1.2.0` - 2019-10-16

### Added

- GDPR consent banner and modular styling to support it
- GDPR context with a provider and consumer
- Better analytics interop architecture
- Cookie management packages
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Robot.txt for Three-Nebula Website
DESCRIPTION: This snippet defines the robot.txt configuration for the Three-Nebula website. It allows all user-agents to access the site and specifies the location of the sitemap for improved crawling and indexing.
SOURCE: https://github.com/creativelifeform/three-nebula/blob/master/website/public/robots.txt#2025-04-20_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
User-agent: *
Sitemap: https://three-nebula.org/sitemap.xml
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Generating Favicons for Three Nebula Website
DESCRIPTION: Command to generate favicons for the Three Nebula website using a custom script.
SOURCE: https://github.com/creativelifeform/three-nebula/blob/master/website/README.md#2025-04-20_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm run favicon:generate
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Generating XML Sitemap for Three Nebula Website
DESCRIPTION: Command to generate an XML sitemap for the Three Nebula website using a custom script.
SOURCE: https://github.com/creativelifeform/three-nebula/blob/master/website/README.md#2025-04-20_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm run sitemap
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Markdown Changelog Entry v1.2.3
DESCRIPTION: Documents addition of Sentry integration and fixes for download release button in version 1.2.3
SOURCE: https://github.com/creativelifeform/three-nebula/blob/master/website/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-20_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
## `v1.2.3` - 2019-11-03

### Added

- Sentry integration

### Fixed

- Issue where the download release button would cause uncaught errors
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Changelog Version Headers
DESCRIPTION: Version headers following semantic versioning format with dates
SOURCE: https://github.com/creativelifeform/three-nebula/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-20_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
## `v10.0.3` - 2021-11-05
## `v10.0.2` - 2021-08-02
## `v10.0.1` - 2021-04-08
## `v10.0.0` - 2020-12-06
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Changelog Entry Format
DESCRIPTION: Standard section headers for categorizing changes in each version
SOURCE: https://github.com/creativelifeform/three-nebula/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-20_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
### Added
### Changed
### Removed
### Fixed
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Changelog Header
DESCRIPTION: Introduction and format description for the changelog
SOURCE: https://github.com/creativelifeform/three-nebula/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-20_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
# Changelog

All notable changes to this project will be documented in this file.

The format is based on [Keep a Changelog](http://keepachangelog.com/en/1.0.0/)
and this project adheres to [Semantic Versioning](http://semver.org/spec/v2.0.0.html).
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Markdown Changelog Entry v1.2.4
DESCRIPTION: Documents fixes for download link functionality in version 1.2.4
SOURCE: https://github.com/creativelifeform/three-nebula/blob/master/website/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-20_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
## `v1.2.4` - 2019-11-03

### Fixed

- Bug where resulting download link was not triggering a download
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Markdown Changelog Entry v1.2.2
DESCRIPTION: Documents fixes for Error component issues in version 1.2.2
SOURCE: https://github.com/creativelifeform/three-nebula/blob/master/website/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-20_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
## `v1.2.2` - 2019-10-20

### Fixed

- Fixed issue with download page's `Error` component that resulted in uncaught errors
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Markdown Changelog Entry v1.2.1
DESCRIPTION: Documents fixes for server-side cookie handling in version 1.2.1
SOURCE: https://github.com/creativelifeform/three-nebula/blob/master/website/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-20_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
## `v1.2.1` - 2019-10-20

### Fixed

- Fixed bug where server side cookies were not being correctly passed to the client
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Markdown Changelog Entry v1.1.1
DESCRIPTION: Documents analytics dependency changes in version 1.1.1
SOURCE: https://github.com/creativelifeform/three-nebula/blob/master/website/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-20_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
## `v1.1.1` - 2019-10-06

### Added

- `universal-analytics` dependency

### Changed

- `Analytics` component now uses `universal-analytics` instead of `next-ga`

### Removed

- `next-ga`
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Markdown Changelog Entry v1.1.0
DESCRIPTION: Documents addition of analytics features in version 1.1.0
SOURCE: https://github.com/creativelifeform/three-nebula/blob/master/website/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-20_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
## `v1.1.0` - 2019-09-26

### Added

- `next-ga` dependency to use Google/Universal analytics with next
- `Analytics` primitive component that uses React Context to provide analytics functionality to anything in the app via the `Analytics` consumer
- Page view tracking
- Event tracking for the download submit button, download platform select component and callout button
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Markdown Changelog Entry v1.0.2
DESCRIPTION: Documents font awesome bug fix in version 1.0.2
SOURCE: https://github.com/creativelifeform/three-nebula/blob/master/website/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-20_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
## `v1.0.2` - 2019-08-26

### Fixed

- Font awesome font size flash (see https://github.com/FortAwesome/react-fontawesome/issues/234)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Markdown Changelog Entry v1.0.1
DESCRIPTION: Documents route compatibility changes in version 1.0.1
SOURCE: https://github.com/creativelifeform/three-nebula/blob/master/website/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-20_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
## `v1.0.1` - 2019-08-25

### Changed

- `content/routes` is now node env compatible
- Ensured that `next.config.js` exports the path map for all routes
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Markdown Changelog Entry v1.0.0
DESCRIPTION: Documents initial release after porting to NextJS in version 1.0.0
SOURCE: https://github.com/creativelifeform/three-nebula/blob/master/website/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-20_snippet_9

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
## `v1.0.0` - 2019-08-22

### Added

- All the things! First release of the `nebula-web` website after porting the entire app to `nextjs`!
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Applying Apache License 2.0 Boilerplate Notice
DESCRIPTION: Standard boilerplate text to include in files when applying the Apache License 2.0 to a project. This notice should be adapted with the appropriate copyright year and owner information.
SOURCE: https://github.com/creativelifeform/three-nebula/blob/master/docs/script/prettify/Apache-License-2.0.txt#2025-04-20_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```

   Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License");
   you may not use this file except in compliance with the License.
   You may obtain a copy of the License at

       http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0

   Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software
   distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS,
   WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied.
   See the License for the specific language governing permissions and
   limitations under the License.
```
